drove africa art thou leagud enemy religion exterminate beleevers ravish alcoran power left spaine assure thy selfe never took part quarrells house assoone saw thee gave thee heart made distinction race marin mansor invented reason justifie thy disloyalty thou art man african thou art doubly disloyall would heaven ambition avarice father confined within limit province daring violated sacred bound nature seperated region prince fez ever heard speak princesse granada honor poore mayden sport thy inconstancy subject calumny stick vaine consideration go miscreant triumph thy pleasure heart doubt thy vanity brought like discourse within thee whats enough truely know thou hast betraid neither great mahomet whose prophesies thou sworst true feare black angells imprint soules perfidious like islander though wood earth thatch yet one symmetry disposed order joynd together thick high inclosure came gate finding open entred court much unlike cloyster carthusian considerd place saw body invulnerable yet bellerophon gave shooting hitting eye made reare red blew crest made head kinde crowne unfold great circle seemd insconcd himselfe suddenly darted himselfe bellerophon infallibly inwrapd extraordinary leape feare warrior horse made knight seeing steed unserviceable alighted cast horse approachd enraged serpent good hap worthy courage arrow strooke right eye learnt serpent yellow panch almanzor perceiving fit marke arrowes shot left till laid dead secure victory went wood thanks heaven vow hang bow arrowes serpent skin returnd city told met feared serpent dead whilst better hearted went see whether almanzor spake truth came palace found every body much troubled presented himselfe abrinzias falling foot sir said humbly beseech majesty pardon fault commited come much impatiency polexander longd much passed night restlesse returned next day heare newes receipt found zelmatida softly walking attending howre princesse waking continued walke together discourse brought geeat alley right izatidas lodge made turnes fourth saw princesse come forth held old mexican band leant head little galtazis sight zelmatida became cold wanne scarce able stand ala polexander said remedy hath beene better rest deity offended thanks tongue prophane mine izatida yesterday imagine say replied polexander let goe neere see whether feares griefes zelmatida would walkd leg trembled forcd leane tree polexander could resettle yet fainting still increased little little lost sense swounded fell downe grasse alcippus diceus ran polexanders call went water recover zelmatida galtazis perceiving stirre imagind straight matter something said princesse misbefalne zelmatida friend troubled run questionlesse remedy infinitely bewaile poore prince said izatida agitation heate spirit brings onely enemy yet could never vanquish let u suffer longer paine since canfree kept way came prince diceus recoverd swound polexander knee hold others head arose saw princesse within twenty pace going meet noted much neatnesse grace dressing conjecturd betided robe body faire mexican stuffes shadowing feather mingled silver gold thread resembled life kinde flower garment fashion mexico came halfe leg nothing buskin imbroidered pearles ruby sleeve kinde silver tiffany cut band joynd together diamond button breast coverd thin white cobweb lawne haire waved black full head dressing rich delicate rope pearle plume making kinde crowne top head fell backward side much gracefulnesse seemd make art dispute nature advantage bestowd princesse polexander could looke without admiration civility would done certainely knowne blinde able make himselfe understood spake signes invited goe neerer prince garruca come aide master perceiving princesse adornd lord cried zelmatidas place stood imposd silence polexander advancd spoke thus come friend give thankes benefit done offer mine arme counsell life accept condition shall please best sweare power adore nothing shall unlinke polexander fourth part polexander third booke imperious reason thou hast boldnesse hope thou promisest thy selfe governe absolutely powerfull rebel body raiseth thee could refraine exclamation incomparable beautie alcidiana voiage said hee himselfe owne disposition hee drew mee hath shut entrance mee ever must yeeld fate necessity without feare stormes hope calmes perfect voyage undertaken diceus said polexander increasest thou happinesse perfect since hope seeing alcidiana regaine best part selfe diceus thou truly lovest mee doe deferre contentment thou mayest give mee find meanes get falling foot feigning discontented man lord said hath given boldnesse present selfe onely long dilated importance cannot without author extreme misfortune impart save selfe charitie indifferently voice countenance lord said name diceus serve king polexander word chiefe priest transported arose taking light stood long gazing diceus last hee clappd taper againe table casting armes diceus neck miracle said art thou risen dead rather deare diceus prodigie canst thou live see thy deare master wrapt dust king life replid diceus though time travell torrid zone changed scarce knowne yet thought affection would never let slip memory ti illustrious slave king gheneoa desire consecrate sun adores heaven honour earth doe wonder replid alcippus emotion felt first sight slave soule cleer fighted mine eye knew disguisd extraordinary agitation made resent happinesse unknowne betided doth deare diceus king master live hath good angell hath rescud many danger power raise againe needed great miracle replid diceus must said alcippus else happend isle astramadan meerly inchantment illusion saw diceus saw place king fell downe dead among great company murderer traitor astramadan armd revenge saw bodie wounded hundred place face disfigured many fearfull gash saw armour strewd bloudy backd piece word saw could assure dead see alone cruell tysiphone beholder shee satiated fury others turnd selfe shee might survive men made capable love amintha saw griefe shee took death would lasted day wave swallowed together bodie diceus lose much time let thee know errours tell therefore miracle good
